notes: Issue #243 is a feature request (type/feature-request, confidence 0.95) asking for ANGLE GPU rendering libraries to be bundled with SkiaSharp for Windows desktop (WPF/WinForms). There is no defective behavior to reproduce — the current behavior (no ANGLE DLLs in NuGet, raster-only WinForms/WPF views) is by design. Verified: SkiaSharp 3.116.1 Win32 NativeAssets contains only libSkiaSharp.dll with no ANGLE binaries; WinForms SKControl uses System.Drawing.Bitmap (raster path). The codebase does have ANGLE infrastructure (GRGlInterface.CreateAngle, AngleSwapChainPanel for WinUI) but these are not exposed for WPF/WinForms. Additionally, reproduction of any Windows-specific behavior is not possible on the current macOS environment.

versionResults.notes: Inspected NuGet package contents. Win32 NativeAssets contain only libSkiaSharp.dll (x64/x86/arm64) — no ANGLE DLLs (libEGL.dll, libGLESv2.dll). This confirms the feature gap but there is no bug to test.
Inspected WinForms SKControl source — uses System.Drawing.Bitmap (raster only), no GPU path. ANGLE infrastructure exists in WinUI views only. No bug behavior to test.

reproductionSteps.description: Inspect SkiaSharp 3.116.1 Win32 NativeAssets NuGet package for ANGLE binaries
Verify WinForms SKControl uses raster-only rendering (no GPU/ANGLE path)
reproductionSteps.output:
46:				using (var surface = SKSurface.Create(info, data.Scan0, data.Stride))

No GRContext, Angle, or GPU references found — confirms raster-only rendering.

reproductionSteps.description: Verify ANGLE infrastructure exists in WinUI views (demonstrating the feature gap between WinUI and WPF/WinForms)

blockers: Feature request (type/feature-request) — no defective behavior exists to reproduce. The absence of ANGLE in the NuGet package is the expected current state, not a bug.
Windows-specific: ANGLE GPU rendering is only relevant on Windows desktop (WPF/WinForms). Current environment is macOS arm64.
